Estimate information criterion for hyperparameter tuning

Source: R/tune_pars.R
tune_pars.Rd

The function tune_pars() estimates the information criterion for hyperparameter tuning. The function returns a numeric value (= information criterion), which is then minimized within a call to optim() for varying hyperparameters.

tune_pars(
  data,
  pars,
  const,
  lags,
  n_fourier,
  period,
  n_diff,
  n_res,
  n_initial,
  n_seed,
  density,
  inf_crit,
  scale_inputs,
  scale_runif
)

Arguments

data

A tsibble containing the time series data.
pars

Numeric vector containing the hyperparameters.
const

Logical value. If TRUE, a constant term (intercept) is used.
lags

A list containing integer vectors with the lags associated with each input variable.
n_fourier

Integer vector. The number of fourier terms (seasonal cycles per period).
period

Integer vector. The periodicity of the time series (e.g. period = c(12) for monthly data or period = c(24, 168) for hourly data).
n_diff

Integer value. The number of differences.
n_res

Integer value. The number of internal states within the reservoir (hidden layer).
n_initial

Integer value. The number of observations of internal states for initial drop out (throw-off).
n_seed

Integer value. The seed for the random number generator (for reproducibility).
density

Numeric value. The connectivity of the reservoir weight matrix (dense or sparse).
inf_crit

Character value. The information criterion inf_crit = c("aic", "bic", "hq").
scale_inputs

Numeric vector. The lower and upper bound for scaling the time series data.
scale_runif

Numeric vector. The lower and upper bound of the uniform distribution.

Value

model_value Numeric value. The information criterion to be minimized.
